pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [d706fb0cc6](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16092/commits/d706fb0cc68018683816487174e7befa0da6d4cd)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ instance : CoeFun (J.Cover X) fun _ => ∀ ⦃Y⦄ (_ : Y ⟶ X), Prop := ⟨fun S => (S : Sieve X)⟩`
`+ instance : CoeOut (J.Cover X) (Sieve X) := ⟨fun S => S.1⟩`
`+ instance : DFunLike (GrothendieckTopology C) C (fun X ↦ Set (Sieve X))`
`- GrothendieckTopology.sheafificationIsoPresheafToSheafCompSheafToPreasheaf`
`- coe_fun_coe`
`- instance : Coe (J.Cover X) (Sieve X)`
`- instance : CoeFun (GrothendieckTopology C) fun _ => ∀ X : C, Set (Sieve X)`
`- instance [HasLimits A] : CreatesLimits (sheafToPresheaf J A) := inferInstance`
`- sieve`
`-- instance : CoeFun (J.Cover X) fun _ => ∀ ⦃Y⦄ (_ : Y ⟶ X), Prop`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10545844401/job/29216578095)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10545844401/job/29216578357)

Do you want to restore the `Coe (J.Cover X) (Sieve X)` instance? It is fine as a `CoeOut` (ie we start with covering and try to fill in as opposed as the reverse). All the commented instances work with that.

The `CoeFun` could just be 
```lean
instance : CoeFun (J.Cover X) fun _ => ∀ ⦃Y⦄ (_ : Y ⟶ X), Prop :=
  ⟨fun S => (S : Sieve X)⟩
```
It is strange that `sieve` is a `def` and not an `abbrev` since the porting note says it is replacing a coercion instance.
Either way. I think that some decision should be made and these comments purged.
Otherwise this looks good to me.

I did this, and the `coe_fun_coe` lemma became a syntactic tautology again. 

If I try to give a `DFunLike` instance for `J.Cover X` instead of the `CoeFun`, I cannot avoid the annoying notation `S _ f` described in the porting note above. Should we just remove the `coe_fun_coe` comment? What about the one about the notation in the `CoeFun` instance?
I would guess because it's `CoeFun`'s all the way down (eg `Sieve` has a `CoeFun` not a `FunLike`).
Ok I removed the porting notes since I feel like this is well understood now. But I'm happy to add them back if someone objects.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(CategoryTheory/Sites): address a bunch of porting notes
